dialogue: -Watch your language, Veroca. Where on earth were you?
We got pulled over at a checkpoint coming back from the drive-in. The guys were going nuts, searching everyone. It was awful.
Another ambassador's been kidnapped. We just saw on TV.
Luckily, Pimpão had his dad's BBA card.
Thanks, Zezé, but I'm not hungry.
Go talk to your dad. He was worried.
But you don't have to choose now. Decide after the trip.
I've already made up my mind, Mom.
Don't spend it all on records. Buy some boots. You need a good pair in the cold.
Thank you. Do you still have that brown coat?
Which one?
The fur-lined one. Eunice picks out a worn suede coat lined with sheep's wool in the armoire.
But it's so old. A gift from your dad. Honeymoon in Bariloche.
Looks brand-new. Can I borrow it?
You'd better behave there. Dalva has enough on her mind.
I can take care of myself, Mom.
All right. Take care of my coat, then, I'll want it back.
I promise. Victorious, Veroca gives her mother a kiss before leaving.
Don't run off right away. I'm going to make a soufflé for you all.
They stayed home to wait for the reporters from Manchete.
Why are those shills coming over?
They need a picture today to get it into the next edition.
Mom, I have to tell you something.
What's that?
Your jacket... I left it with Helena. She begged me so long I just couldn't say no.
That's all right, it'd been stored away for so long. Helena will make better use of it in London.
Are you all right?
Sure I am, honey. How about you?
Have you heard any news?
Vera, please, the kids.
In London, it's in all the papers--
-Honey.
I wish I could've made a welcome- home soufflé, honey, but there was no time.
Not hungry?
I think it'll take a few days for me to get over the time difference.
